definition: lit. to make one's way through a dangerous pass as if walking on level ground (idiom)/fig. to handle a crisis effortlessly
shoe/to tread on
danger/dangerous/rugged
as/as if/such as
non-Han people, esp. to the East of China/barbarians/to wipe out/to exterminate/to tear down/to raze
to turn peril into safety (idiom); to avert disaster
as solid as rock (idiom); as sure as houses
handling any occasion smoothly (idiom); equal to any situation
dangerous and difficult (path)
countless difficulties/extremely difficult/against all odds
see 一往無前|一往无前[yi1 wang3 wu2 qian2]
to handle easily (idiom); effortless
in peril/facing disaster
see 百折不撓|百折不挠[bai3 zhe2 bu4 nao2]
see 泰然處之|泰然处之[tai4 ran2 chu3 zhi1]
dangers spring up all around (idiom); surrounded by perils
free to come and go (idiom)/to have room to maneuver
to seek life in death (idiom); to fight for one's life
to talk and laugh as though nothing had happened/to remain cheerful (despite a crisis)
as secure as Mount Taishan/as solid as a rock
untold dangers and difficulties (idiom)
